k8s_version.description: __Filterable__ The desired Kubernetes version for this Kubernetes cluster in the format of <major>.<minor>, and the latest supported patch version will be deployed.

label.description:
__Filterable__ This Kubernetes cluster's unique label for display purposes only. Labels have the following constraints:

  - UTF-8 characters will be returned by the API using escape sequences of their Unicode code points. For example, the Japanese character _か_ is 3 bytes in UTF-8 (`0xE382AB`). Its Unicode code point is 2 bytes (`0x30AB`). APIv4 supports this character and the API will return it as the escape sequence using six 1 byte characters which represent 2 bytes of Unicode code point (`"\u30ab"`).

  - 4 byte UTF-8 characters are not supported.

  - If the label is entirely composed of UTF-8 characters, the API response will return the code points using up to 193 1 byte characters.

items.description: Specifies a collection of Linodes to serve as members of a Kubernetes cluster.

autoscaler.description: When enabled, the number of nodes automatically scales within the defined minimum and maximum values. When making a request, `max` and `min` require each other.

enabled.description: Whether automatic scaling is enabled for this node pool. Defaults to `false`.

max.description: The maximum number of nodes to automatically scale to. Defaults to the value provided by the `count` field.

min.description: The minimum number of nodes to automatically scale to. Defaults to the node pool's `count`.

count.description: The number of nodes in the Node Pool.

disks.description:
This node pool's custom disk layout. Each item in this array will create a new disk partition for each node in this node pool.

> 📘
>
> Omit this field, except for special use cases. The disks specified here are partitions in _addition_ to the primary partition and reduce the size of the primary partition. This can lead to stability problems for the node.

  - The custom disk layout is applied to each node in this node pool.

  - The maximum number of custom disk partitions that can be configured is 7.

  - Once the requested disk partitions are allocated, the remaining disk space is allocated to the node's boot disk.

  - A node pool's custom disk layout is immutable over the lifetime of the node pool.

items.description: The values to assign to each partition in this Node Pool's custom disk layout.

size.description: The size of this custom disk partition in MB. The size of this disk partition can't exceed the capacity of the node's plan type.

type.description: This custom disk partition's filesystem type.

labels.description:
Key-value pairs added as labels to nodes in the node pool. Labels help classify your nodes and easily select subsets of objects. To learn more, review [Add Labels and Taints to your LKE node pools](https://www.linode.com/docs/products/compute/kubernetes/guides/deploy-and-manage-cluster-with-the-linode-api/#add-labels-and-taints-to-your-lke-node-pools).

**Label key:**

- A key can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`), or dots (`.`). Start and end it with an alphanumeric character.

- If the key begins with a DNS subdomain prefix followed by a single slash, for example `example.com/my-app`, the maximum total length of the label key is 128 characters. Domain labels can be up to 62 characters after the '/'. The prefix needs to adhere to [RFC 1123](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1123) DNS subdomain restrictions.

- If the key doesn't begin with a DNS subdomain prefix, the maximum key length is 63 characters.

Specifying an empty object removes all previously set labels.

**Label value:**

- The label's value can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`), or dots (`.`). Start and end it with an alphanumeric character.

- Can be specified as an empty string value with `""`.

tags.description: __Filterable__ An array of tags applied to this object. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

taints.description:
Kubernetes taints to add to node pool nodes. Taints help control how pods are scheduled onto nodes, specifically allowing them to repel certain pods. To learn more, review [Add labels and taints to your LKE node pools](https://www.linode.com/docs/products/compute/kubernetes/guides/deploy-and-manage-cluster-with-the-linode-api/#add-labels-and-taints-to-your-lke-node-pools).

Specifying an empty array (`[]`) removes all previously set taints.

effect.description: The Kubernetes taint effect. For `NoSchedule`, `PreferNoSchedule` and `NoExecute` descriptions, see [Kubernetes Taints and Tolerations](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/).

key.description:
The Kubernetes taint key.

- A key can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`), or dots (`.`). Start and end it with an alphanumeric character.

- If the key begins with a DNS subdomain prefix followed by a single slash, for example `example.com/my-app`, the prefix part needs to adhere to [RFC 1123](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1123) DNS subdomain restrictions and be a maximum of 253 characters.

value.description:
The Kubernetes taint value.

- A key can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes (`-`), underscores (`_`), or dots (`.`). Start and end it with an alphanumeric character.

- Can be specified as an empty string value with `""`.

type.description: The Linode Type for all of the nodes in the Node Pool.

tags.description: __Filterable__ An array of tags applied to the Kubernetes cluster. Tags are for organizational purposes only.

tier.description:
__Beta__, __Filterable__ The desired Kubernetes tier, either `standard` or `enterprise`.
